sentences.english: He died in 1892, his death being considered as a national calamity.
sentences.chinese: 他死於1892年，他的逝世被認爲是舉國的不幸。

sentences.english: The death of the premier was reported in the newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 總理的逝世已在各報紙上報道。

sentences.english: He am watching TV when he Listend acres the death of the president.
sentences.chinese: 他看電視時，突然聽到主席逝世的消息。

sentences.english: China has benefitted from three major advantages after Mao Zedong's death in 1976.
sentences.chinese: 1976年毛逝世後，中國受益於三大主要優勢。
特科於星期五逝世，享年96歲。

sentences.english: Hancock died while serving his ninth term as governor.
sentences.chinese: 漢考克逝世在他的第九屆州長任期上。

sentences.english: I read about her death in this morning's paper.
sentences.chinese: 我在今天早晨的報紙上讀到她逝世的消息。

sentences.english: Slobodan Milosevic of Serbia died in a Dutch prison.
sentences.chinese: 塞爾維亞統治者米洛舍維奇在一所荷蘭監獄逝世。

sentences.english: Afterthe great Judge Ehud died, we were completely helpless.
sentences.chinese: 自從偉大的埃胡德逝世，我們感到很無助。

sentences.english: December eighth marked the thirtieth anniversary of John Lennon's death.
sentences.chinese: 十二月十八標誌着約翰列儂逝世三十週年。

sentences.english: I commiserate with you on the loss of your mother.
sentences.chinese: 你母親逝世，我特向你慰問。

sentences.english: Love is my religion. -I could die for it. ~John Keats.
sentences.chinese: 愛你是我的信仰，我願意爲你而逝世。

sentences.english: We wish to express our deep regret over the passing of your husband.
sentences.chinese: 對你丈夫的不幸逝世我們深感痛惜。

sentences.english: By the time of his death, even the once-loyal Army was starting to mutiny over low pay.
sentences.chinese: 他逝世後，曾一度忠誠的軍隊因爲低收入而譁變。

sentences.english: Ethel Lilian died in America in 1960.
The president's death had unexpected repercussion.
sentences.chinese: 總統的逝世引起出乎意料的反響。

definition: to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
to live to the (ripe) age of
to die/to depart from the world forever
to die/to depart this mortal coil
lit. to fly on a crane to the Western Paradise/fig. to pass away (idiom)
to die an untimely death (idiom)/to be cut off in one's prime
to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die
